text:
Byko: How liberals squelch opposing points of view Updated: January 10, 2017 — 5:07 PM EST 40 Share Stu Bykofsky Daily News Columnist Stu Bykofsky has been a columnist with the Daily News since 1987. He has been features editor, theater critic, TV critic, and gossip columnist. He supports animal causes, civil rights, and fair play, and opposes political correctness, bicycles on the sidewalk, and most other forms of selfishness and stupidity. More by Stu Bykofsky 
Journalist and TV pundit Kirsten Powers has a problem with her own people — 
In her recent book, The Silencing, 
The illiberal left is a loud group that mastered social media, helps steer academia and runs what I call "alt-left" websites. Those are fountainheads of victimization where you can drown in slippery, socially-engineered terms such as mansplaining , trigger warnings , microaggressions , (fill in the blank) privilege , cisgender , rape culture 
Silencing the opposition is a totalitarian tactic that has blossomed in our bitterly partisan political era. Eve 
As an example, what had been a traditional view of marriage for millennia — one man, one woman — 
It also smacks of the Salem witch trials — 
It was liberals, not conservative racists, who called Justice Clarence Thomas a self-loathing "Uncle Tom" and Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice "Aunt Jemima" —
